author: Khmer Times/Muny Sithyna
title: Weather Conditions Worse in 2015
text:
PHNOM PENH, (Khmer Times) – According to the First Vice President of the National Committee for Disaster Management (NCDM), Nhim Vanda, the weather conditions in Cambodia have worsened in 2015 compared to the previous year, with irregular rainfalls impacting significantly on agricultural activities.
Mr. Nhim Vanda told reporters on Saturday morning at the closing ceremony of the ASEAN Day for Disaster Management (ADDM) 2015, that the potential for natural disasters in the Kingdom had worsened compared to the previous year, due to the limited rainfall and heavy winds.
“This year it has been worse,” said Mr. Vanda. “The irregularity [in weather] is the heavy wind, drought, and irregular rainfall.”
“We have seen that up until now there’s no flood from the Mekong River,” said Mr. Vanda. “I would say that disaster management is not hard for our country, but what I am afraid of is no water for farming.”
Cambodia has become known as a flood-prone country which takes the lives of many people in the rural provinces every year.
According to the NCDM, during the first nine months of this year 89 people died as a result of natural disasters, however officials say this figure is not expected to increase as the rainy season is now reaching its end.
